alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:27AM EST until February 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 AM EST, the gauge on the Little Muskingum at Bloomfield was at 20.1 feet and is slowly rising. At stages above 16 feet, Route 26 near the intersection of Route 260 floods. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marietta. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
